docs.lead_paragraph: The story of how basic questions about what to eat got so complicated reveals a great deal about the institutional imperatives of the food industry, nutritional science and journalism.
docs.snippet: The story of how basic questions about what to eat got so complicated reveals a great deal about the institutional imperatives of the food industry, nutritional science and journalism.

headline.print_headline: Debate in India: Is Rule on Yoga Constitutional?
headline.main: Debate in India: Is Rule on Yoga Constitutional?

headline.seo: Positively American - Chuck Schumer - Books - Review

docs.lead_paragraph: In his provocative first book, Senator Charles E. Schumer of New York offers a smart, tough-minded appraisal of the Democratic Party’s weaknesses and challenges.

headline.print_headline: Weight and Diabetes Are Focus Of Health Foundation Grants
headline.main: Weight and Diabetes Are Focus of Health Foundation Grants

docs.lead_paragraph: A health foundation created by New York State announced its first grants yesterday, devoting considerable attention to obesity and resulting problems like diabetes, and to asthma. It also addressed other ills as disparate as alcohol abuse and lack of dental care.

headline.print_headline: For Obese Children, Increased Risks in Surgery
headline.main: On the Scales: For Obese Children, Increased Risks in Surgery

docs.lead_paragraph: Extra weight on children can cause complications in surgery, a new study suggests.
docs.snippet: Extra weight on children can cause complications in surgery, a new study suggests.

headline.main: For Obese Children, Increased Risks in Surgery

docs.abstract: Dr Olubukola O Nafiu of University of Michigan Health System leads study that suggests growing problem of childhood obesity is impacting surgical events for children; obese children face similar surgical risks as do obese adults; research, which discusses medical complications that often accompany obesity, is published in Journal of the National Medical Assn (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: The risks associated with the growing problem of obesity among young people may be extending to the operating room table. Researchers at the University of Michigan Health System have found that almost a third of the children who needed surgery there over a four-year period were overweight. Of those, more than half could be considered obese. The study appears in the current Journal of the National Medical Association.
